description:
Hard to take this package seriously when profile root directory isn't even taken seriously since 2020 apparent bug report. Didn't care to find out what it would do to backup/restore process. Went with their "Advanced installation" because snap itself (not Firefox snap directly) doesn't consider "Accessibility" aspect for those that need it.
1625111 - [Flatpak] The profile root folder is not correctly displayed in about:profiles
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1625111
summary: Was going to file a bug report, found out it was in 2020

description:
Firefox used to be smaller, faster, and easier to customize. Ever since it started copying Chrome though it's gone downhill, sometimes worse. It's not as bad as it used to be, but it still has a ways to go before it reaches previous levels.

Pros:
+ less RAM and CPU heavy than Chrome
+ WAAAAAAAY more tabs can be open and still use less resources than Chrome
+ still more customizable than alternatives
+ has a version for pretty much every OS, even less common ones
+ FireFox Sync (for settings sync across devices)

Cons:
- nowhere near the low resources levels of yesteryear's FireFox
- not as easy to customize the look and feel of the tab bar
- no compact UI layout
it takes like 5 minutes to open
Best browser for Steam Deck
Yeah Its pretty good.

I vote this is better than Chrome. You just have to give up on the "wHy ThE FaK ArNt YoU uSiNg ChRoMe, DiKhEaD" mood. 
Also, if you already have chrome or another common browser, migrating is super easy, I clicked some three times and everything is here now.
Mozilla respects your privacy and security much more than Google does. Being intruded is an option, and it starts by running away from the people trying to intrude you.
I love Firefox. It's so easy to sync to devices and it works great!

summary: supporting the web never felt so good

description: Recently, I updated my computers to Ubuntu 22.04. So far, I haven't really had any issues, save for one major thorn in my side: Canonical's insistence on using snaps for default applications. A lot of people have a lot of issues with snaps, many of which are fair, some of which don't really make sense, but one I strongly agree with is that starting snap apps just takes far too much time. Flatpaks aren't "fast," but they're much quicker than snaps, and have all the benefits I care about. Now, I can actually use the web browser without wanting to tear my hair out.
summary: Good alternative to the much slower snap

I love firefox, and have used it for decades. Lately memory ussage is just massive. Just closed the thing and it freed 5G ram, only after one day of browsing sessions, perhaps 10-20 tabs, it is insane. I went to mozilla support and the suggestion is to uninstall extensions and/or add ram.
Now that Firefox Quantum is not only available on Flatpak, but also Wayland and VA-API compatible, it's just the best browsing experience on Linux, hands down.
After install it says in the settings that it's being "managed by my organization". Not sure why. Uninstalled.

I'm a user of all major web browsers. Firefox is my daily driver on most OS's. Because at work we use Google Cloud Platform, and Google's cloud console is broken on Firefox, I have chrome open on the same machine, as well. Further, Gmail/Gsuite are a superior experience within Chrome versus Firefox.

But that experience isn't better because Chrome is better: it's due to shoddy frontend engineering practices on Google's part (across the board w.r.t. their product engineering, sans their non-frontend engineering teams). 

So do your part and avoid allowing Google to profit from your data pipeline. There's a better world out there for you and Firefox is probably a part of it.
Its low in resources (especially on Linux) and that best inbuilt privacy features. uBlock is most performant on Firefox.
I've been using Firefox Flatpak for more than 6 months, and everything works as intended. Good work developers!
Great privacy controls.

description:

Now? It's heavy, slow, and ugly.
Ungoogled chromium is a much better alternative. It's Chromium so it has better site rendering than Gecko, much faster, better UI, and has no Google so you can easily disable tracking.
can't watch any wildvine media in this version of the browser, uninstall and install the real one

ublock Origin funktioniert nur eingeschränkt, viele essenziell Funktionen sind eine Katastrophe (man riskiert z.B. vollständigen Profildatenverlust, wenn man FF neu installiert - einmal waren alle Passworte und Modifikationen/Einstellungen weg, Bookmarks... habe ich ja als Backup - zum Glück)
Die Profildaten werden wohl nur noch von Google für Werbung nutzbar gemacht, ich kann mich aber als User nicht mehr darauf verlassen.
Überhaupt geraten Linux-Distros immer mehr unter ähnliche Einflüsse wie früher die Mozilla-Stiftung... und werden wohl irgendwann auch so enden - inklusive Googlefox... ähem... Firefox.

Cabe señalar que para que se vean bien los contenidos multimedia requiere tener instalado el codec ffmpeg-full (instalable desde repositorio Flathub).
Disfrutando el nuevo Firefox 100 en Fedora desde el repositorio Flathub (Flatpak). La actualización llegó antes que la versión nativa (rpm) y que la version Snap de Ubuntu.
